title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 03 May 2016 - XWiki
content:

09:14 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <Denis> has quit  
09:58 <vmassol1> has quit  
09:58 <ClemensR> has quit  
09:58 <ansuz> has quit  
09:59 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <acotiuga> Hello!  
10:02 <acotiuga> Is there any way to get, in Java, the name of the current document, without passing any parameters ?  
10:05 <tmortagne> I guess the easiest is trough DocumentAccessBridge#getCurrentDocumentReference()  
10:15 <vmassol> Hi acotiuga  
10:15 <vmassol> and everyone  
10:15 <acotiuga> Hi vmassol!  
10:21 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
10:39 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <vmassol> guys, one question: do we have a way to link to the source code of a page when that code is in an xobject (ie have a url that points to it) ? :)  
10:42 <vmassol> AFAIK we can't  
10:44 <Enygma`> we can only link to an object in edit mode AFAIK  
10:44 <Enygma`> since view mode does not really make sense for an object  
10:44 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
10:45 <vmassol> Enygma`: could be nice to support view source for objects too at some point, anyway I'll have to copy the content instead f linking to it  
10:45 <vmassol> (I'm writing a blog post)  
10:45 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <lkrejci> has quit  
10:51 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:06 <vmassol> lkrejci: hi  
11:06 <vmassol> lkrejci: you'll like this: http://massol.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/ByeByeCLIRRWelcomeRevapi :)  
11:13 <lkrejci> vmassol: ooh, nice.. :)  
11:25 <tmortagne> crap I used commit -a instead of commit...  
11:40 <flashdel> has quit  
11:41 <acotiuga> tmortagne: thanks for your solution. I still have an issue: while I'm calling DocumentReferenc#getName() from DocumentAccessBridge#getCurrentDocumentReference(), I get NullPointer: http://pastebin.com/hwsMR4QG  
11:42 <acotiuga> I'm using it on a functional test, which is the cause on the 46 seconds  
11:43 <tmortagne> acotiuga: it does not make any sense to use this component in a UI test since its giving you the current document in your instance, not the one in the remote instance  
11:43 <tmortagne> you asked for Java, not for a test  
11:44 <tmortagne> I'm not sure how to get the current document but you probably have something for it in TestUtils  
11:51 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:56 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
12:45 <woshilapin> has quit  
12:46 <lkrejci> has quit  
12:46 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
12:46 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <vmassol> Enygma` and all: I've added a blog post linking to my personal post about revapi: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/ByeByeCLIRRWelcomeRevapi  
13:39 <Enygma`> vmassol: cool!  
13:51 <lkrejci> has quit  
13:51 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <vmassol> ClemensR, sdumitriu: when you have a few minutes, I'd love a reply on my proposal for updating the governance for xwiki.org  
15:16 <vmassol> thanks! :)  
15:18 <vmassol> guys, I think we need to only display the latest release notes by default on e.x.o pages  since that makes page loading slower to display otherwise. Another idea is to have links only and open another page for having release notes details  
15:18 <vmassol> this seems the best to me  
15:21 <lkrejci> has quit  
15:21 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <vmassol> just created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13393  
15:23 <boubou> hey guys  
15:23 <boubou> I deployed xwiki entreprise 8.0.war  
15:23 <boubou> Xwiki start loading and it stop at 50%  
15:23 <boubou> http://pastie.org/private/2lia93psdrz9kompwchg  
15:24 <boubou> anyone can explain me why please ?  
15:26 <vmassol> java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver  
15:26 <vmassol> that's your issue, you should read the installation instructions  
15:27 <boubou> A JDBC 4 Driver for your database (JDBC 3 was required for XWiki versions < 7.0)  
15:27 <boubou> ahhh ;)  
15:28 <lkrejci> has quit  
15:31 <msmeria> has quit  
15:31 <vmassol> quite a lot of red and yellow on ci.xwiki.org  
15:31 <vmassol> +17 failing tests for platform: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/  
15:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: maybe you should have a look at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-extension-handler-xar/2835/testReport/  
15:32 <vmassol> and http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-extension-test-tests/2835/testReport/  
15:33 <acotiuga\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <acotiuga> has quit  
15:34 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
15:37 <boubou> vmassol could you give me a hint how to install the jdbc 4 driver ?  
15:37 <boubou> I just installed :mysql-connector-java-5.1.25-3.el7.noarch  
15:37 <boubou> but it doesnt look to work  
15:38 <vmassol> !search mysql  
15:38 <vmassol> first link  
15:38 <vmassol> (if you want to use mysql)  
15:40 <boubou> sure  
15:41 <boubou> should it works ?  
15:41 <boubou> https://downloads.mariadb.org/connector-java/  
15:59 <vmassol> xwiki.org crash … restarting  
15:59 <vmassol> (restarted)  
16:09 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <acotiuga\_> has quit  
16:32 <boubou> should it works ?  
16:32 <boubou> https://downloads.mariadb.org/connector-java/  
16:33 <boubou> vmassol
